content.description: Another unique, unlikely yet beautiful CK route.  Begin with funky steming working up a dihedral that slowly peters out.  Step up and right onto the arete feature.  Carefully pick your way up this on cool balancey holds.  I broke the anchor clipping jug completely off in '09 when it was brand new.  Somewhat slopey-er now, sorry.  The book says 5.10-.  I thought this and Elvis Shades seemed to be solid 5.10's.
content.location: Left most of the Alexanders Arete routes beginning in the dihedral

content.description: This is sharp, like other nearby face routes.  Clip the first bolt and work through very thin face moves for 3 more bolts.  Use of the mono pocket may be necessary.  Pull onto the ledge with slopers and continue on easier 5.10 climbing above.
content.location: First bolt line on the face next to the cave.  There are two more routes on the face to the left before the route in the dihedral.

content.description: Big moves to big holds, with a lot of foot swapping, so the pump clock is ticking.  Crux move may be a dyno for some, it is certainly very big, and the best hold is the one furthest away.  Good warmup for the Daily Planet routes.
content.protection: 6 bolts, although the base is so sloping and loose that the logical start skips the first bolt.  Fixe rap rings for anchors.
content.location: On the extreme left edge of Antarctica, above and just left of the top of the Daily Planet Boulder.

content.description: Closely spaced bolts protect the entry moves after stepping off the flake onto slab.  A very hollow flake near the 4th bolt detracts from an otherwise great outing.  You have to manhandle this time bomb and launch back left onto the wall into the crux.  Great holds and fun moves complete the journey.
content.location: Currently by itself behind a 20 foot free standiing boulder.  Begin by stepping off a flake onto the wall.

content.description: This route is very sustained like it's right-hand neighbor "Elvis Shades Rule".  Both are great routes that will continue to refine with age.
content.protection: Twelve bolts to a two-bolt anchor.
content.location: This route is on "Alexander's Arete", and starts to the right of a large bush and to the left of the passage formed by the leaning pillar that leads to the "Frat Boys Wall".  It is to the right of "Wild Turkeys" and immediately to the left of "Elvis Shades Rule".

content.description: Continuous .10 climbing up a thin and delicate face. Start with some dead vertical pulling up a steep wall with small pockets and thin edges, work you way through using holds which are perfectly placed leaving just enough to work with. Reachy and tense with a difficult start, its good, do it!
content.location:
Next route right of

Moon Units Secret Shinto Ride, The Fabulous Gordini

, sits on a separate face and shares the the first two bolts with another route to its right.

content.description: Follow thin holds past an undercling to better holds over several bulges to a final pumpy bit on water runnels to the anchors.  Sustained and hard to read.
content.location: Second route left of the Big Man On Campus flake, or third route right of the Wild Turkeys chimney.

content.description: Extension to Burning Grandma Bones.  Continues past 11b anchor on roof moves.

Starts with a few stiff bouldery moves before settling in on the arete.  Here several good rests can be found.  The route then moves left continuing on some nice vertical face climbing until the final roof finishing on some big holds.
content.location: Look for the blunt arete ending at a right tending arch.  No other routes found on either side.
